intro: Malacoxylum pinnatum, commonly known as the silky mallow, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and conservation efforts.
